channel.title: Game Creators
channel.description:
A friend of mine wants to make a game (or two) but he can't find a good program to do it with. I don't know any good ones either. He will pay for them, and he doesn't care if it's free.
He is doing a 3D environment, but he will try a 2D if there is a good, easy to use, free program that you can create it with.
He has Windows 7, so it has to be compatible with that. Otherwise, it will just take up space until he gets rid of it.
He doesn't want to make a mod of anything.
Any suggestions?

item.title: Game Creators
item.dc:creator: lambda
item.description:
Multimedia fusion 2 for reaaal simple start, and you COULD use the Cube 2 engine, that’s not to hard i think.

Read full topic

item.title: Game Creators
item.dc:creator: GilCMassey
item.description:
Looks like its gonna be a good game

At the rate we are going, we might get several of these suggestions, just to see what will work to what he wants. I don’t actually know what his idea is exactly, but it is probably going to be first person or like yours, just to start.

I am just in charge of the story behind it, dialog, voice acting(if it is needed) and that stuff. I am actually not taking part in the actual creation part. He is the sole developer. I am just his lackey XD

Read full topic

item.title: Game Creators
item.dc:creator: GravityGun
item.description:
Game Maker 8 for sure if you are just starting out like me. I’m making a free top down shooter called fresh dead. Check it out here-> https://www.lcrazykidgames.webs.com

Read full topic

item.title: Game Creators
item.dc:creator: GilCMassey
item.description:
Maverix26:

Screw it, i’ll be the first to say it

I’m almost certain there is no friend in the situation, and it’s just you asking for different kinds of engines to use.

Anyways, yea i’d go with the unreal engine, jsut because of its potential

No, it’s not just me. I am the story behind his idea, not the tech. Why screw it? And why the sudden burst of rage?

Thank you, I will tell him that the Unreal engine has been recommended, several times now, with enthusiasm.

I couldn’t give less of a damn about creating a game, even if I tried. I just like to make the stories behind the face of the art.

Read full topic

item.title: Game Creators
item.dc:creator: Maverix26
item.description:
Screw it, i’ll be the first to say it

I’m almost certain there is no friend in the situation, and it’s just you asking for different kinds of engines to use.

Anyways, yea i’d go with the unreal engine, jsut because of its potential

Read full topic

item.title: Game Creators
item.dc:creator: GilCMassey
item.description:
Yeah. there are some disadvantages to it… I looked at it after he downloaded it, and it didn’t look easy to use. That could be me. Also, You don’t get much unless you get the pro version. But since he is just testing ideas, that is ok…

Read full topic

item.title: Game Creators
item.dc:creator: dky.tehkingd.u
item.description:
Katana:

Just as a note, some people in my class got a bunch of Unity3D game prototypes working pretty well, even if their game concept was 2D (ie, 3D graphics, 2D play, like Super Smash Brothers or Trine)
My team used ActionScript, and it went so fast that we actually got to the “maybe” part of our to-do list.

I’ve been lurking this particular thread and the Unity site and it’s sounding really good… almost too good. Are there any actual disadvantages to it?

Read full topic

item.title: Game Creators
item.dc:creator: Katana
item.description:
Just as a note, some people in my class got a bunch of Unity3D game prototypes working pretty well, even if their game concept was 2D (ie, 3D graphics, 2D play, like Super Smash Brothers or Trine)
My team used ActionScript, and it went so fast that we actually got to the “maybe” part of our to-do list.

Read full topic

item.title: Game Creators
item.dc:creator: higgsboson
item.description:
Flash may be a good place to start. It’s not free but it’s worth it.

Read full topic

item.title: Game Creators
item.dc:creator: GilCMassey
item.description:
gugamilare:

Since no one suggested yet, I’ll suggest RPG Maker. Yes, it’s only for RPGs, but it is very intuitive and flexible. It also has a nice set of images and the Internet is full of images for you to use.
I don’t know how is the situation now, but I think you will need to pirate it because the English version is not legal.

I am pretty sure I saw a download for it a few months ago… I could be wrong. I think that may have been adventure maker…

Read full topic

item.title: Game Creators
item.dc:creator: gugamilare
item.description:
Since no one suggested yet, I’ll suggest RPG Maker. Yes, it’s only for RPGs, but it is very intuitive and flexible. It also has a nice set of images and the Internet is full of images for you to use.
I don’t know how is the situation now, but I think you will need to pirate it because the English version is not legal.

item.title: Game Creators
item.dc:creator: Chickenprotector
item.description:
^ I don’t play minecraft. And read the latter half of the sentence you quoted… I’ll leave it off there.

Edit: If your friend’s a college student and is looking for modeling, I’d look into Autodesk Resources; https://students.autodesk.com/

Having a school e-mail and being enrolled at college gives you some major advantages for utilization of some programs you feel like tinkering around with… for free. Autodesk are the makers of Maya, and yes; that’s available for your use. For free.

Read full topic

item.title: Game Creators
item.dc:creator: BahamutBBob
item.description:
Chickenprotector:

I don’t know which ones, I don’t care which ones.

Minecraft. I’m surprised you don’t know, what with half the forum (more?) being obsessed with it right now.

Read full topic

item.title: Game Creators
item.dc:creator: GilCMassey
item.description:
Chickenprotector:

https://unity3d.com/

It’s free to use and Java’s one of the most simple programming languages out there. Unity uses that and it’s a mainstream engine. It’s used on games for the I-Phone, and various games on the PC, I don’t know which ones, I don’t care which ones.

I’d go with that, I tinkered around with it once or twice but decided to go onto a different engine to toy around with.

Edit: Take note, there is a free version and a “Pro” version, I’d go with the free version for basic software, then when you get the cash buy the full set of toys if you’d like.

I showed the pictures to him, and his jaw hit the floor. He never thought he would be able to toy with anything like this. He says thanks!

Read full topic

item.title: Game Creators
item.dc:creator: Maxey
item.description:
Unreal Development Kit

Might have a bit of a learning curve, but the Unreal Engine 3 is very versatile and powerful.

Read full topic

What did they do the new Rayman game coming out with?

They were talking about… wait…

item.title: Game Creators
item.dc:creator: Ramirezoid
item.description:
Actionscript is super duper easy. Provided your friend doesn’t suck at Flash, he can have a decent platformer going in under an hour.

Upload it to Newgrounds with an ad in the preloader and make a few bucks + there’s potentially hundreds of thousands of unique players

Read full topic

item.title: Game Creators
item.dc:creator: FireTime
item.description:
well 2D you can always go back to flash. There are some powerful actionscript engines out there plus seeing as it’s flash you get a quick return on investment. Plus x-browser & x-platform.

Down side of this is that the knowledge gained doesn’t translate too well to a 3d engine. (with the exception of some programming styles or routines)

Read full topic

item.title: Game Creators
item.dc:creator: GilCMassey
item.description:
JamesKane:

Either a program like Gamer Maker or he will need programming skills for an engine like torque-2d ( https://www.torquepowered.com/products/torque-2d ).

Depends how well is skills are and his ability to adapt and learn.

we both adapt and learn very well. we don’t have much in the way of programming skills.

Read full topic

item.title: Game Creators
item.dc:creator: GilCMassey
item.description:
sudpuzzer:

If he could learn DarkBasic, that would be a good start. It’s a powerful, yet simple coding program that contains a 3D engine. Not sure if that’s what he’s looking for though. Does he want a really simplified ‘game maker’ or a full out coding utility?

Simple to use at first. He just wants to start with testing, not a full out attempt.

Read full topic

item.title: Game Creators
item.dc:creator: JamesKane
item.description:
pfannkuchen_gesicht:

he could use the good old quake 3 engine, afaik it’s free

He could, but then he would end up wasting more time making it a 2d system rather then using an existing 2d engine.

Read full topic

item.title: Game Creators
item.dc:creator: pfannkuchen_gesicht
item.description:
he could use the good old quake 3 engine, afaik it’s free

Read full topic

item.title: Game Creators
item.dc:creator: Ramirezoid
item.description:
He can write his own engine, use an existing one, or adapt an existing one.

There’s supposedly some really slick freeware engines that come with easy-to-use interfaces and everything, but I wouldn’t know where to find those.

Read full topic
